description: System-generated unique identifier for this supplier–item record; primary key.
Audit datetime when the row was created or last updated, stored as a compact numeric timestamp; confirm format.
Supplier’s catalog or SKU for the item, as used on purchase orders and invoices.
Expected time between ordering and delivery from the supplier, likely in days; confirm unit.
Free‑text notes about pricing, terms, or other details of this supplier–item relationship.
Unit cost quoted by the supplier for this item, excluding taxes/fees; currency per system settings.
Coded classification of the supplier–item relationship (e.g., preferred, alternate, OEM); values defined externally; confirm meaning.
Name of the lookup source for the classification code; confirm usage.
Supplier identifier, foreign key to the supplier master.
Qualifier naming the entity referenced by the supplier identifier (e.g., supplier master table).
Identifier of the stocked item this row refers to, foreign key to a warehouse-level item record.
Name of the table that the item identifier references; enables polymorphic foreign keys.
Identifier of the related record in the source legacy system; used for migration traceability.
Name of the source legacy table from which this row was migrated.
